codeanticode.planetarium

Class DomeCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • codeanticode.planetarium.DomeCamera

  • public class DomeCamera
extends java.lang.Object
    Enables interaction (e.g. changing settings) with Dome renderer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DomeCamera

        public DomeCamera(PApplet parent)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        parent - the current sketch. Must have have already been initialized with "Dome.RENDERER" as renderer (by calling setup()). Supposed to have a single instance per sketch.

      • scale

        public void scale(float s)

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Sets rendering of the reference grid.
        Parameters:
        mode - accepts two values: Dome.NORMAL and Dome.GRID.

      • setDomeAperture

        public void setDomeAperture(float theAperture)
        Sets the Dome aperture, i.e. the radial (in cartographic terms, latitudinal) coverage of the image.
        Parameters:
        theAperture - is a normalized value. 1f is regular, fulldome aperture, equals 90° from center to border or 180° across the image.

      • imageToForeground

        public void imageToForeground(PImage theImage,
                              int x0,
                              int y0,
                              int w,
                              int h)
        Renders into a separate PGraphics object, which is displayed after the execution of the draw() call, thus rendering "on top" of everything else. For performance reasons, should be placed inside the pre() method. Its contents are cleared each frame.
        Parameters:
        theImage - the image to be drawn.
        x0 - the x coordinate of the upper left corner of the image.
        y0 - the y coordinate of the upper left corner of the image.
        w - the width of the image, to which it should be scaled.
        h - the height of the image, to which it should be scaled.

      • getFace

        public int getFace()
        Returns the currently rendered face index.
        Returns:
        0 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_X 1 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_X 2 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Y 3 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Y 4 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Z 5 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Z

      • toggleFaceDraw

        public void toggleFaceDraw(int theFace)
        Toggles the rendering into a cubemap face by index.
        Parameters:
        theFace - 0 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_X 1 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_X 2 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Y 3 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Y 4 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Z 5 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Z

      • setFaceDraw

        public void setFaceDraw(int theFace,
                        boolean doDraw)
        Sets the rendering into a cubemap face by index.
        Parameters:
        theFace - 0 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_X 1 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_X 2 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Y 3 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Y 4 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Z 5 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Z
        doDraw - true or false

      • getFaceDraw

        public boolean getFaceDraw(int theFace)
        Informs if a given face is being rendered into.
        Parameters:
        theFace - 0 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_X 1 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_X 2 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Y 3 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Y 4 == DomeCamera.POSITIVE_Z 5 == DomeCamera.NEGATIVE_Z
        Returns:
        true if the given camera is being updated.

      • setCubemapSize

        public void setCubemapSize(int theSize)
        Sets the cubemap size, i.e. the resolution of each(!) of the (potentially) 6 cameras we are rendering into.
        Parameters:
        theSize - the desired cubemap resolution. Will be rounded up to the next power of two smaller than the maximum texture size supported by the graphics card.
